stories.text:
There was a great thread a couple of weeks ago on with tips on writing documentation that devs love: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=31945863

A lot of commenters on that thread mentioned DigitalOcean as an example of great docs for a product.

Does anyone have examples of great docs / user guides for open source projects? I'd like to study well done open source docs and learn more about what can be added to the docs to make them more useful for devs.
stories.title: Ask HN: What open source projects have great documentation?
Baseball Fans Might Be Ready for Robo Umpires

stories.text:
On hn.algolia.com, we can query any country and get an amount of comments including them. Here is the result for a few countries.

- America: 222,768;

- Europe: 111,534;

- Spain: 456,337; Spanish: 22,370;

- Germany: 119,946; German: 94,084;

- France: 118,108; French: 69,935;

- Italy: 43,990; Italian: 16,344;

- United States: 59,387;

- Americans: 211,929;

- China: 137,033; Chinese: 70,745;

- Japan: 74,701; Japanese: 45,844;

- Korea: 50,201; Korean: 41,437;

How would you get the stats on *all* countries or keywords?
stories.title: Tell HN: Stats on some country occurences on HN
